p: Virola venosa are trees up to 30 m and have ellipsoidal or subglobular fruits, with dimensions of 19–22 mm long and 16–18 mm in diameter [ 8]. They have glabrous or sparse pubescent leaves on the bottom part and are wedged at the base, with thin venules and remarkable prominules in both parts, and inflorescences with 2–3 branches [ 9].
